intro: Hieracium mundalense, commonly known as the southern marsh hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in wetlands and marshy areas, adapting to moist, nutrient-rich soils. It produces yellow flowers that are surrounded by pale green ray florets, and its leaves are lance-shaped with hairy surfaces. Hieracium mundalense is often found in swampy habitats, contributing to the ecological diversity of these environments.
